Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there are no credible media reports indicating that Cullamat made the quoted remarks about her daughter's death.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the graphic in the misleading posts did not come from ABS-CBN News, as confirmed by a representative from ABS-CBN.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the graphic is genuine when it has been proven to be manipulated.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the quote by attributing it to a legislator and implying that it reflects her true sentiments, when there is no evidence to support this.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the origin of the manipulated graphic, as it was found to have been published on a Facebook account other than ABS-CBN's.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting misleading information and manipulating the original ABS-CBN graphic.
Understate: The claim understates the impact of ABS-CBN's operations being slashed and its loss of advertising revenues, which affected its ability to function as a news organization.
